tier.item: (39) a. Sia ra-ha'a ba ngao ede (Bima)
'(S)he has been bitten by the cat.'
(39) a. Sia ra-ha'a ba ngao ede (Bima)
'(S)he has been bitten by the cat.'
(S)he has been bitten by the cat.
b. Wela ede di-weli ba La Amir
kite that PASS.IRR-buy by ART NAME
'The kite will be bought by Amir'

(5) a. Sia na ­mbei ana dou ede buku (Bima)
`(S)he is going to give the child a book'

(6) Mbe'e ede ra-nduku ba ompu sia
`The goat was hit by his/her grandfather'

(42) a. Sia ndawi-wea-na nahu kuru nasi (active)(Bima)
`(S)he has made a bird cage for me'
(42) a. Sia ndawi-wea-na nahu kuru nasi (active)(Bima)
`(S)he has made a bird cage for me'
(S)he has made a bird cage for me
b. Nahu ndawi-wea ba sia kuru nasi (pass.)
`For me, the bird cage was made by him/her'
b. Nahu ndawi-wea ba sia kuru nasi (pass.)

c. * Kuru nasi ede ndawi-wea nahu ba sia (pass.)
`The bird cage was made by him/her for me'

(3) Amu hanta wa'a.na meja ese uma. (Bimanese)
Amu pick-up carry.3 table up-to house
`Amu (picked up and) carried the table up to the house.'

`Rao went in and slept.' (lit. `made herself sleep.')
